newsitem.title: USA: IPO HIGHLIGHTS - Mixed bag for IPOs on heavy day.
newsitem.headline: IPO HIGHLIGHTS - Mixed bag for IPOs on heavy day.

text.p: A swarm of initial public offerings that hit Wall Street on Friday had mixed debuts, with pizza franchisee PJ America Inc surging almost 33 percent.
Birmingham, Alabama-based PJ America rose four to 16-1/2. It operates 42 Papa John's pizza stores, is profitable, and posted revenue growth of 95.7 percent between 1993 and 1995.
Although several companies garnered strong premiums, others could not rise above their IPO prices.
Among other companies that made their market debuts Friday:

-- Metris Cos Inc shares jumped 4-3/4 to 20-3/4. The direct marketer of credit cards offered 2,833,333 shares for $16 each. Metris was previously a wholly owned subsidiary of Fingerhut Cos Inc, which will own about 85 percent of the outstanding shares of Metris.

-- Optimal Robotics Corp shares were at 5-7/8 from their IPO pricing of $5.50 a share. The company develops systems aimed at offering automated teller machines for some transactions, like buying groceries in convenience stores.
-- Triumph Group Inc jumped 17 percent, up 3-1/4 to 22-1/4 on the New York Stock Exchange. Triumph makes aircraft components like mechanical control systems and instruments.

-- Infinity Financial Technology Inc shares rose two to 18. Infinity develops object-oriented, client/server platform and solutions software for financial trading and risk management. It offered 2.5 million shares. Goldman Sachs was the lead underwriter of the offering.
-- International Telecommunications Data Systems Inc shares rose one to 17.
-- U.S. Franchise Systems Inc rose to 14-1/8 from its IPO price of 13-1/2. The Atlanta company franchises hotels.
Its initial brands are the Microtel Inns budget hotel and the upscale, extended-stay Hawthorn Suites.
-- UroQuest Medical Inc was flat at six.
-- Award Software International Inc was flat at eight.
-- Stage Stores Inc rose 2-1/2 to 19. The company, the parent of Specialty Retailers Inc, had suspended a planned public offering in late July.
-- Simulation Sciences Inc shares rose 1-1/4 to 10-1/4.
-- Cubist Pharmaceuticals Inc shares were flat at 6-1/2.
NOTE: PJ america is trading under the temporary symbol "TEMPA" according to the Nasdaq Stock Market. Its permanent symbol remains "PJAM."
